issues.title: [XChange] Add basic support for crypto currency ticker
"CAMEL-12115:Camel-Consul: Upgrade to 1.0.0 consul client"
CAMEL-12079: Bean language: support bean::function notation
Salesforce composite api external ids in body support
issues.body:
Hope it is of use :-)

1. Introducing support for Salesforce Composite REST API (https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.api_rest.meta/api_rest/resources_composite_composite.htm). I could not find any related jira..

2. Extending the salesforce maven plugin to generate of DTO(s) for doing updates via Salesforce External Ids in the “body” json field. 
` 
         "body" : {
              "Account__r":
              {
                "External_Id_Of_Account__c" : "123456"
              } ,
            "AnotherField__c":"1234"
          }
`
Related jira is https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CAMEL-10193. The implementation is the proposed solution mentioned in the discussion.

Thanks!!

issues.title: CAMEL-11780: camel-amqp - SSL Transport configuration
issues.body: Added amqps support, upgrading the qpid-jms-client version.

issues.title: Set org.apache.core as the jkd9 automatic module name for camel-core
issues.body:
This will be useful for people wanting to use Java 9's module system with camel-core. 

From Mark Reinhold's recommendation and common adoption, the module name should correspond to the principal exported API package:

> Strongly recommend that all modules be named according to the reverse
    Internet domain-name convention.  A module's name should correspond
    to the name of its principal exported API package, which should also
    follow that convention.  If a module does not have such a package, or
    if for legacy reasons it must have a name that does not correspond to
    one of its exported packages, then its name should at least start
    with the reversed form of an Internet domain with which the author is
    associated.

Thanks!

issues.title: CAMEL-11879: Upgraded lucene version to 7.0.0
issues.body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CAMEL-11879
Upgraded Lucene to latest version 7.0.0. 

Passed the iTests for Karaf and OSGi without issues, including the camel-lucene component tests.

issues.title: CAMEL-11658: test for RestletProducer handling unencoded headers
issues.body:
This is just a unit test showing how a header with characters that are not allowed in URI path will cause a failure within RestletProducer.

CAMEL-11658: The regression is only for some characters (such as space). Other characters actually didn't work very well before (question mark "?" could cause other parts of path to become query, etc.).

issues.title: CAMEL-10803 Base undertow component on http-common
issues.body:
# Please don't merge

I would like some feedback on this first. Still to do:
- [x] Make `UndertowComponent` and `UndertowEndpoint` extend `HttpCommonComponent` and `HttpCommonEndpoint`
- [ ] Implement support for options from `http-common` component
   - [x] `chunked`
   - [ ] `disableStreamCache`
   - [ ] `proxyHost`
   - [ ] `proxyPort`
   - [ ] `authMethodPriority`
   - [ ] `connectionClose`
   - [ ] `traceEnabled`
   - [ ] `responseBufferSize`
   - [ ] `ignoreResponseBody`
   - [ ] `copyHeaders`
   - [ ] `eagerCheckContentAvailable`
   - [ ] `mapHttpMessageBody`
   - [ ] `mapHttpMessageHeaders`
   - [ ] `mapHttpMessageFormUrlEncodedBody`
   - [ ] `okStatusCodeRange`
   - [ ] `urlRewrite`
   - [ ] `async` (though Undertow is heavily async, so may be ignored)

issues.title: CAMEL-10349, javaScript setHeader conversion fault

commit.message: CAMEL-12158 - Camel-AWS DdbStream: Use a configuration for the options like the other AWS components
CAMEL-12157 - Camel-Websocket Karaf feature installs bundles with different version of Jetty (9.4 and 9.3)

CAMEL-12156: Camel Karaf commands for routes should flip the order so camel context is first, so the route completion can use the selected camel context to only show routes from that context. And make both arguments as required as they should be.
Upgrade Chronicle Bytes to version 1.10.6
CAMEL-11907: Improve test coverage for pgevent component
Upgrade HttpCore to version 4.4.9
CAMEL-12149 minor fix
fix CAMEL-12149 ensure the CONTENT_TYPE header can be retrieved

Indicate new Maven version requirement 3.3.3 for Camel 2.20 build

see http://camel.apache.org/camel-2200-release.html#Camel2.20.0Release-Importantchangestoconsiderwhenupgrading

Signed-off-by: Aurélien Pupier <apupier@redhat.com>
Upgrade Undertow to version 1.4.22.Final
Upgrade Atmosphere to version 2.4.19
Upgrade Rabbitmq Amqp client to version 5.1.2
Upgrade Kotlin
Camel AWS DDB - Regen docs
Camel AWS DDB - secretKey and accessKey are secret
CAMEL-12152 - Camel-AWS DDB: Add the ability to specify credentials and region at component level
CAMEL-12153 Upgrade OpenTracing Java API version to 0.31
Camel-AWS CW - Regen docs
Camel-AWS CW - accessKey and secretKey are secret
CAMEL-12151 - Camel-AWS CW: Add the ability to specify credentials and region at component level
CAMEL-12150 - Camel-AWS EC2: Add the ability to specify credentials and region at component level

CAMEL-12061: camel-ftp now forces a hard disconnect in case of rollback such as error during scanning files etc, to force a fresh client/login on next poll to mitigate any transient issues in the ftp client.
Polished
Upgrade OS Maven Plugin to version 1.5.0.Final

CAMEL-12148: Reworked FileIdempontentRepository so LRUCache is only act as quick lookup. And in case of 1st-level miss the file store is checked. File store also writes the entries in the same order they are added.
Regen docs

CAMEL-12148: Reworked FileIdempontentRepository so LRUCache is only act as quick lookup. And in case of 1st-level miss the file store is checked. File store also writes the entries in the same order they are added.
CAMEL-12147 - Camel-AWS MQ: Add the ability to specify credentials and region at component level
Camel AWS Lambda - Regen Docs and SB
Camel-AWS Lambda - Fixed the javadoc related to the LamdbaClient

hey @segalziv! So though I think this change is fine. I contemplated doing this with my original PR but eventually decided against it to preserve existing behavior with bulk requests.

I'd consult @davsclaus perhaps on how to handle breaking changes (as anyone now relying on the existing behavior of a list of IDs will now be getting an ES java client object back).

Sorta on a similar line of thinking, I think this component's contract needs to be a bit more consistent when it comes to responses. In some cases it returns fields of an elasticsearch java response object (like the id, or in the case of the bulk request, the list of ids) and in some cases it returns the response object itself. By _not_ returning es-java objects it allows someone to decouple themselves from using that library in their downstream code that uses the component, though in certain cases (like bulk requests) using the es java client is required (which was the original reason for my PR).

Thanks for your reply!

Hi,

You need to refer your custom bus (`cxf`) in the endpoint URI:

```
from("cxf:/incident?serviceClass=" + IncidentService.class.getName() + "&bus=#cxf")
```

Otherwise Camel will try to create the bus for you. Unfortunately Camel refreshes Spring context while creating default bus, what collides a little bit with the Spring 4 application lifecycle.

Please try it and let me know how it works. BTW I will use your example as a base for Camel+CXF tests. I will also try to make camel-spring-boot and camel-cxf a bit smarter to handle bus registration nicely.

Cheers!
Thanks.

We are not supposed to use com.sun packages unless you have good explain of it.

But then we can not find out if a folder is an IMAP folder and we can not call the specific methods we need for sorting (only IMAP supports sorting).
The dependencies I referenced are all part of the maven dependency javax.mail/mail, they are not dependent on the type of JDK/JRE we are running (even though they have the com.sun prefix).
To make it short: there is no way of implementing this functionality without using stuff from com.sun.mail. But I think in this situation it not a problem.
OK, I got it, we can treat the com.sun.mail as a third part jar. I will merged the code shortly.

InputStream (this shouldn't be mapped to type Stream, that's incorrect)
ByteBuffer
File
Reader
etc..

Not a compaint or so, but is there some specific reason why you would use messageCount instead of just returning getConfig().consumableUsers().size() ?

Yup, though both should ideally be the same, one is an assumption and another is a reality. In future if someone adds a logic to handle/unhandle exception then this logic does not need to be modified as it always signifies the real number of messages consumed, else it might creep in a bug if this logic isnt changed. Just a general practice I try to follow - fact vs assumption.

` 
         "body" : {
              "Account__r":

              } ,
            "AnotherField__c":"1234"
          }
`
Related jira is https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CAMEL-10193. The implementation is the proposed solution mentioned in the discussion.

Thanks!!

issues.title: CAMEL-11780: camel-amqp - SSL Transport configuration
issues.body: Added amqps support, upgrading the qpid-jms-client version.

issues.title: Set org.apache.core as the jkd9 automatic module name for camel-core
issues.body:
This will be useful for people wanting to use Java 9's module system with camel-core. 

From Mark Reinhold's recommendation and common adoption, the module name should correspond to the principal exported API package:

> Strongly recommend that all modules be named according to the reverse
    Internet domain-name convention.  A module's name should correspond
    to the name of its principal exported API package, which should also
    follow that convention.  If a module does not have such a package, or
    if for legacy reasons it must have a name that does not correspond to
    one of its exported packages, then its name should at least start
    with the reversed form of an Internet domain with which the author is
    associated.

Thanks!

issues.title: CAMEL-11879: Upgraded lucene version to 7.0.0
issues.body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CAMEL-11879
Upgraded Lucene to latest version 7.0.0. 

Passed the iTests for Karaf and OSGi without issues, including the camel-lucene component tests.

issues.title: CAMEL-11658: test for RestletProducer handling unencoded headers
issues.body:
This is just a unit test showing how a header with characters that are not allowed in URI path will cause a failure within RestletProducer.

CAMEL-11658: The regression is only for some characters (such as space). Other characters actually didn't work very well before (question mark "?" could cause other parts of path to become query, etc.).

issues.title: CAMEL-10803 Base undertow component on http-common
issues.body:

I would like some feedback on this first. Still to do:

   - [ ] `urlRewrite`
   - [ ] `async` (though Undertow is heavily async, so may be ignored)

commit.message: CAMEL-12158 - Camel-AWS DdbStream: Use a configuration for the options like the other AWS components
CAMEL-12157 - Camel-Websocket Karaf feature installs bundles with different version of Jetty (9.4 and 9.3)

CAMEL-12156: Camel Karaf commands for routes should flip the order so camel context is first, so the route completion can use the selected camel context to only show routes from that context. And make both arguments as required as they should be.
Upgrade Chronicle Bytes to version 1.10.6
CAMEL-11907: Improve test coverage for pgevent component
Upgrade HttpCore to version 4.4.9
CAMEL-12149 minor fix
fix CAMEL-12149 ensure the CONTENT_TYPE header can be retrieved

Indicate new Maven version requirement 3.3.3 for Camel 2.20 build

see http://camel.apache.org/camel-2200-release.html#Camel2.20.0Release-Importantchangestoconsiderwhenupgrading

Signed-off-by: Aurélien Pupier <apupier@redhat.com>
Upgrade Undertow to version 1.4.22.Final
Upgrade Atmosphere to version 2.4.19
Upgrade Rabbitmq Amqp client to version 5.1.2
Upgrade Kotlin
Camel AWS DDB - Regen docs
Camel AWS DDB - secretKey and accessKey are secret
CAMEL-12152 - Camel-AWS DDB: Add the ability to specify credentials and region at component level
CAMEL-12153 Upgrade OpenTracing Java API version to 0.31
Camel-AWS CW - Regen docs
Camel-AWS CW - accessKey and secretKey are secret
CAMEL-12151 - Camel-AWS CW: Add the ability to specify credentials and region at component level
CAMEL-12150 - Camel-AWS EC2: Add the ability to specify credentials and region at component level

CAMEL-12061: camel-ftp now forces a hard disconnect in case of rollback such as error during scanning files etc, to force a fresh client/login on next poll to mitigate any transient issues in the ftp client.
Polished
Upgrade OS Maven Plugin to version 1.5.0.Final

CAMEL-12148: Reworked FileIdempontentRepository so LRUCache is only act as quick lookup. And in case of 1st-level miss the file store is checked. File store also writes the entries in the same order they are added.
Regen docs

Camel-AWS Lambda - Fixed the javadoc related to the LamdbaClient

hey @segalziv! So though I think this change is fine. I contemplated doing this with my original PR but eventually decided against it to preserve existing behavior with bulk requests.

I'd consult @davsclaus perhaps on how to handle breaking changes (as anyone now relying on the existing behavior of a list of IDs will now be getting an ES java client object back).

Sorta on a similar line of thinking, I think this component's contract needs to be a bit more consistent when it comes to responses. In some cases it returns fields of an elasticsearch java response object (like the id, or in the case of the bulk request, the list of ids) and in some cases it returns the response object itself. By _not_ returning es-java objects it allows someone to decouple themselves from using that library in their downstream code that uses the component, though in certain cases (like bulk requests) using the es java client is required (which was the original reason for my PR).

Thanks for your reply!

Hi,

You need to refer your custom bus (`cxf`) in the endpoint URI:

```
from("cxf:/incident?serviceClass=" + IncidentService.class.getName() + "&bus=#cxf")
```

Otherwise Camel will try to create the bus for you. Unfortunately Camel refreshes Spring context while creating default bus, what collides a little bit with the Spring 4 application lifecycle.

Please try it and let me know how it works. BTW I will use your example as a base for Camel+CXF tests. I will also try to make camel-spring-boot and camel-cxf a bit smarter to handle bus registration nicely.

Cheers!
Thanks.

We are not supposed to use com.sun packages unless you have good explain of it.

But then we can not find out if a folder is an IMAP folder and we can not call the specific methods we need for sorting (only IMAP supports sorting).
The dependencies I referenced are all part of the maven dependency javax.mail/mail, they are not dependent on the type of JDK/JRE we are running (even though they have the com.sun prefix).
To make it short: there is no way of implementing this functionality without using stuff from com.sun.mail. But I think in this situation it not a problem.
OK, I got it, we can treat the com.sun.mail as a third part jar. I will merged the code shortly.
Can we change the default pull delay time to save some test time?
This seems incorrect, you should be asking to convert the payload into a byte[], not a BytesMessage which you already created on the previous line.

This method needs to be modified to check all possible types of things that can be converted into a byte array.
To name a few:
InputStream (this shouldn't be mapped to type Stream, that's incorrect)
ByteBuffer
File
Reader
etc..

While you're at it you might want to fix up, the mapping of Collection to Map.. (Doesn't seem correct) and add more types that can be converted to Text, char[], char, Character, StringReader, etc.
ByteBuffer is Bytes not Stream
File is Bytes not Stream.
Reader is Bytes not Stream.
This test doesn't test the type of JMS Message produced.. You should be asserting that a BytesMessage was produced. And that the contents of the Exchange.getIn().getBody() is a byte[].

review_comments.body: I'm wondering if it's better to do getBody() here with an instanceof instead. I'm concerned that with the type converters in place we'll try to coerce things when we shouldn't.
ill remove this author tag.
Not a compaint or so, but is there some specific reason why you would use messageCount instead of just returning getConfig().consumableUsers().size() ?

Yup, though both should ideally be the same, one is an assumption and another is a reality. In future if someone adds a logic to handle/unhandle exception then this logic does not need to be modified as it always signifies the real number of messages consumed, else it might creep in a bug if this logic isnt changed. Just a general practice I try to follow - fact vs assumption.
